main event: A large, bright orange object was observed in Concord, Massachusetts on June 14, 1960, moving rapidly and blinking.
interesting points: The object was first seen in the south-southwest and last seen in the west., The sighting lasted approximately 30 seconds., The presumed speed of the object was considered excessive for a balloon., No sound was reported during the sighting., The object was classified as a balloon in the conclusion despite its unusual behavior.
witness description: The witness observed the object from a screened porch and described it as extremely bright and large, similar to a star in appearance.
